newsitem.title: USA: Fidelity Investments forms commercial company.
newsitem.headline: Fidelity Investments forms commercial company.

text.p: Fidelity Investments said Monday it had formed a commercial technology company to develop, acquire and market computer system products and software for the financial services business and other sectors.

It said the company, Fidelity Technologies, would belong to a new umbrella organization called Fidelity Technology and Processing Group, which has overall responsibility for its computer systems, processing and electronic distribution.
Fidelity Technologies would develop commercial markets for its MAXXESS/MAXXnet investment research and market data systems and its CAPS corporate action processing system, it said.
Fidelity Investments, a mutual fund company, said the new company would also relaunch a bank trust processing business that it had acquired from Broadway & Seymour Inc earlier this year.
